patterns: what is the vision of uc?
how about the vision of uc?
responses:
University of Cebu vision is to:
- Democratize quality education.
- Be the visionary and industry leader.
- Give hope and transform lives.

patterns: what is the mission of uc?
how about the mission of uc?
what are the goals of uc?
how about the goals of uc?
what are the core values of uc?
how about the core values of uc?
responses:
The University believes in these core values: 1. INNOVATION Be the visionary and industry leader.
2. CAMARADERIE Living in the spirit of harmony and approachability.
3. ALIGNMENT All activities are geared towards core values and priorities.
4. RESPECT Always a professional, mindful of God, University, community and self.
5. EXCELLENCE To be great at whatever it is we do and go for the best.

patterns: How to enroll as a new student?
How to apply for admission as a new student?
What are the admission requirements as a new student?
What is the admission process like for new students?
responses:
Here's how you can apply as a new student!

1. At the time of enrollment, a new student must submit his/her
high school report card (Form 138), duly certified by the principal,
his/her NSO birth certificate, as well as his/her Certificate of Good
Moral Character from his/her principal or guidance counselor.

2. Only a graduate of a recognized high school shall be considered
for enrollment as a new student.

3. For Maritime courses, the following Department of Health (DOH)
medical requirements are annually required: urine, stool, CBC, X-
ray, psychological, eye sight (Ishihara for BSMT and Lantern or any
other color perception test for BSMARE), and hearing examination
(per CMO #13, Series 2005); and Hepatitis B Screening.

patterns: How to enroll as a transferee?
How to apply for admission as a transferee?
What are the admission requirements as a transferee?
What is the admission process like for transferees?
responses:
Here's how you can apply as a transferee!

1. At the time of enrollment, a transferee must submit the following credentials:
	1.1 Certificate of transfer credential from the school last attended;
	1.2 Statement of good moral character signed by an adviser and certified
	by the school dean/head and/or the student affairs director; and
	1.3 Informative copy of his/her TOR, which includes the descriptive
	title of the subjects taken, the number of units and the grades earned.

2. A transferee should have at least 30 units to complete, a grade
point average (GPA) of at least 2.5 in all subjects already taken,
and no more than 2 failures to be admitted. He/she should have
at least one-year residence in the University prior to graduation.

3. A department may choose to give a validating examination to a
transferee whose GPA is below 2.5. Entrance exams administered
by the Guidance Office is a requirement for the transferee’s
admission to the University.

patterns: How to enroll as a returnee?
How to apply for admission as a returnee?
What are the admission requirements as a returnee?
What is the admission process like for returnee?
responses:
Here's how you can apply as a returnee!

1. If in any one semester or summer session, a student failed in one-
third of the units for which he/she is registered, he/she may not
enroll in the same program without the written recommendation
of the college Dean. If the student failed the second time, he/she
may enroll in another program if accepted by the Dean of the new
program. If the student failed in similar manner for the third time,
he/she shall be disqualified from registration in the University.

2. The disciplinary rules and regulations of the Commission on
Higher Education (CHEd) and the University govern the non-
academic reasons for the non-readmission of a student.

patterns: How to enroll as an alien?
How to enroll as a naturalized filipino?
How to enroll as a student with foreign name?
How to apply for admission as an alien?
How to apply for admission as a naturalized filipino?
How to apply for admission as a student with foreign name?
What are the admission requirements as an alien?
What are the admission requirements as a naturalized filipino?
What are the admission requirements as a student with foreign name?
What is the admission process like for aliens?
What is the admission process like for naturalized filipinos?
What is the admission process like for students with foreign name?
responses:
Here's how you can apply if you are an alien, naturalized filipino
or a student with foreign name!

1. Philippine-born alien students must submit a photocopy of their
Alien Certificate of Registration (ACR) and Native-Born Certificate
of Registration (NBCR), certified against the original by the CHEd
Regional Office.

2. Children of naturalized Filipino citizens must submit a copy of
Identification Certificate issued by the Commissioner of
Immigration and certified against the original by the CHEd
Regional Office.

3. Filipino citizens whose family names are of foreign origin must
submit their birth certificates issued by the Local Civil Registrar.
Foreign-born alien students must submit a photocopy of their
ACR, certified against the original by the CHEd Regional Office.

patterns: How to enroll as a foreigner?
How to apply for admission as a foreigner?
What are the admission requirements as a foreigner?
What is the admission process like for a foreigner?
responses:
Here's how you can apply as a foreign student!

1. For overseas students, who are still abroad, they may apply for
admission in writing with the University Registrar and submit the
following admission requirements:
	1.1 Six (6) copies of the duly accomplished Personal History
	Statements (PHS) signed in English and in his/her
	national alphabet. PHS form is available at the Philippine
	Foreign Services Post (PFSP) in the applicant’s home
	country;
	1.2 Six (6) copies of the original Transcript of Scholastic
	Records duly authenticated by the PFSP in the student’s
	country of origin or legal residence;
	1.3 Six (6) copies of the notarized Affidavit of Adequate
	Financial Support (AAFS) including bank accounts or
	notarized Notice of Grant for institutional scholars to
	cover expenses for the student’s accommodation and
	subsistence as well as school dues or other incidental
	expenses;
	1.4 Six (6) copies of the data page of the applicant’s passport
	showing the date and place of birth, duly authenticated
	by the PFSP in the applicant’s country of origin or legal
	residence; and
	1.5 Remittance of Acceptance Fee of US$ 120.00 to cover the
	issuance of Notice of Acceptance (NOA), handling and
	mailing of the above documents to the Philippine
	Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA) and mailing of a
	copy of NOA to the applicant.
	1.6 The DFA needs the above-mentioned documents to
	process the issuance of a Student Visa.

2. For foreign students, who are already in the Philippines under any
visa category, may apply in the Bureau of Immigration (BoI) for
the change/conversion of his/her admission status to that of a
student under Section 9(f) of the Philippine Immigration Act of
1940, as amended pursuant to Executive Order No. 285.
Requirements:
	2.1 Written endorsement from the University Registrar;
	2.2 NOA;
	2.3 Six (6) copies of the notarized proof of AAFS to cover
	expenses for the student’s accommodation and subsistence as well as
	school dues and other incidental expenses.
	2.4 Six (6) copies of the original Transcript of Scholastic
	Records, duly authenticated by the PFSP in the student’s
	country of origin or legal residence;
	2.5 Six (6) copies of the Police Clearance Certificate issued by
	the national police authorities in the student’s country of
	origin or legal residence, duly authenticated by the PFSP
	having consular jurisdiction over the place for a student
	who resided in the Philippine for less than 59 days.
	However, for students who resided in the Philippines for
	more than 59 days at the time he/she applies for said
	change/conversion of his/her admission status to that of
	a student, he/she shall also be required to submit the
	National Bureau of Investigation (NBI) clearance;
	2.6 Six (6) copies of the Quarantine Medical Examination
	Certificate issued by the National Quarantine Office;
	2.7 Six (6) copies of student’s PHS, signed by the student
	with a 2x2-inch recently taken photograph;
	2.8 Six (6) copies of the data page of the applicant’s passport
	and the stamp of the latest arrival; the passport itself
	shall be presented for verification; and
	2.9 Remittance of Acceptance Fee of US$ 120.00 to cover the
	issuance of NOA, handling, and mailing of the above
	documents to the BoI, Manila.

3. For foreign students who wish to transfer from one Philippine
higher educational institution (HEI) to another, the requirements
are:
	3.1 NOA from accepting school;
	3.2 Letter of No Objection issued by the BoI; and
	3.3 Certificate of Transfer Credentials and Certificate of Good
	Moral Character issued by the previous school.

4. Scheduling of Processing of Student Visa:
	4.1 For first semester applicants: January 1 to April 15
	4.2 For second semester applicants: June 1 to September 15
	4.3 For summer classes applicants: December 1 to January 31

5. In accordance with the regulations of CHEd and other government
agencies supervising foreign students, no foreign student may be
allowed to enroll unless he/she can submit a valid permit to study
and a student’s visa to the Foreign Students Section of the
University Registrar.

patterns: How to enroll as a special student?
How to apply for admission as a special student?
What are the admission requirements as a special student?
What is the admission process like for a special student?
responses:
Here's how you can apply as a special student!

1. They receive approval from the Dean and/or department
Chairperson for each of the course they intend to participate in;
2. They sign an agreement that they waive the right to receive and
to demand credit for the work done [Section VIII, par. 144,
Manual of Regulations for Private School (MORPS), 1970, 7th
edition] and that they pay in full the fees at the time of
enrollment; and
3. Special students are not eligible for any honors or privileges.

patterns: How to enroll as a graduate student?
How to apply for admission as a graduate student?
What are the admission requirements as a graduate student?
What is the admission process like for a graduate student?
responses:
Here's how you can apply as a graduate student!

Graduates who hold the appropriate bachelor’s
degree or its equivalent are eligible for admission to studies leading to
the Master’s degree. Prospective graduate students shall submit their
application for admission and other requirements to the Graduate
School Office within a reasonable period before the opening of each
term.
